results.name: Primitive part of Lucas(n).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
J. Brillhart, P. L. Montgomery and R. D. Silverman, Tables of Fibonacci and Lucas factorizations, Math. Comp. 50 (1988), 251-260, S1-S15. Math. Rev. 89h:11002.
C. K. Caldwell, Lucas Aurifeuillian primitive part
formula: Primitive part of L(n) is primitive part of F(2n).
a(n) = Product_{ d divides 2*n } Fibonacci(2*n/d)^mu(d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 08 2004
results.author: _David Broadhurst_, Jun 10 2001
